content.prompt:
Article XI The Emperor has the supreme command of the Army and Navy.

Article XIII The Emperor declares war, makes peace, and concludes treaties.

Japan’s 1889 constitution

Article IX Aspiring sincerely to an international peace based on justice and order, the Japanese people forever renounce war . . . and the threat or use of force as a means of settling international disputes.

In order to accomplish the aim of the preceding paragraph, land, sea, and air forces . . . will never be maintained.

Japan’s 1947 constitution

The differences in the passages above are most likely a result of which of the following?

choices.label: Ideological struggles between communist and capitalist political parties
The Japanese emperor’s acceptance of Enlightenment ideals
Demilitarization imposed by the United States after the Second World War
The persistence of mass antiwar protests in Japan

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Compare the arguments or main ideas of two sources.
